intro: Acosmium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved acosmium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical woodlands. Due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
